author: Master_Wu
title: Pink and juicy!
review:
The watermelon dude is a great minifigure! He is a little less detailed, but is a lot of fun!

The watermelon piece on his head is a nice looking slab of watermelon with details for seeds, rinds, and a hole for the minifigure to see out of! This guy has a two-sided face: one shows a plain smile, and the other shows a cool smile with dark sunglasses. He wears a plain green T-shirt underneath and some pants that are half pink, and half white with green corners. He also holds a slice of watermelon and comes with an extra in case you loose it!

I really like this minifigure and recommend it for any lego fan who collects minifigures.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Party with Melons.
review:
Set #71023 Watermelon Dude: This fun-loving foodie has dressed up as his favourite fruit. To be fair though he should be Slice-Of-Watermelon Dude, because he's not dressed up as the whole round melon.

I actually discussed this new element in my recent review of Series 19's Pizza Costume Guy. This large costume element covers the unprinted torso partially, it is printed on both sides with seeds from the Watermelon. His legs are dual-moulded with white and pink colours while some minor green printing has been included. He carries two printed half-round tiles as Watermelon Slices. His expressions are smiling lopsidedly like Han Solo or smiling lopsidedly like Cool Guy Han Solo. (Because he's wearing shades.)

Overall I'm a huge fan of quirky designs done right and I really dig Watermelon Dude as a solid offering. He stands out a bit more, but still there is not a whole lot of Characterisation for some of these characters. Still, I'd recommend this Minifigure to everybody. Recommended.
